question:
With respect to Archaeological Survey of India taking up renovation works surrounding the Shore Temple, consider the following statements about this temple:
  1. It is a rock-cut temple.
  2. It was built during the Chola Dynasty.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Â Statement 1 is incorrect: The Shore Temple is located in Mamallapuram in Tamil Nadu. It is a structural stone temple. This temple represents the oldest of the structural Hindu temples in South India. It was constructed out of granite. The area is being beautified With reference to the upcoming Indo-China informal meet. Statement 2 is incorrect: The Shore Temple was constructed during the Pallava Dynasty. It was constructed by Narasimhavarman II. The Cholas took up elements of the structural temple architecture style after they came into power by defeating the Pallavas. The area was a busy port during the Pallava era.
